Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, as you have completed this book, which is the last of medical science, through the fulfillment of its author, and due to its expositions, and its declarations, it seems to me that you have achieved great proficiency in this treatise, which is a part of the most important operation, namely surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The most important operation, surgery, is scorned in our region and in our time as being entirely useless, since the science of it has fallen into decline; and there are only a few small descriptions of it found in the books of the Ancients, which have led to greater confusion and error, as the understanding of it is closed and its power extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has been observed by me that this treatise should be revived according to the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that the forms of cautery tools and other surgical instruments are added to the explanations, and in preparation for the operation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for which our skilled artisans are not as effective in this our time is because the art of medicine is complex, and requires expertise in the science of anatomy to understand the youth of the members and their forms, the conjunction and separation of them; knowledge of bones, nerves, and ligaments, and the names of these, and the extraction of them; as well as the pulsing veins and those that are tranquil, and the locations of the emission of them.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason, Hippocrates says that the name is fitting, but in practice, it is small, especially in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this at the beginning of this book; for whoever is not aware of what we have said about anatomy, will not be exempt from falling into errors that lead to the death of men, as you have seen many such people who are formed in this science but lack knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Why do you see a foolish doctor who has incurred a scrofulous abscess in the thigh of a woman, and cut some arteries in her thigh so that much blood flowed until the woman died between his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you saw another doctor who prescribed a stone from a man who had suffered in his state; the stone was large, and it came to him and tore that stone with part of his bladder, so that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called for help to extract it, and you saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, he knew that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you saw another doctor who was paid handsomely by a duke from our land for surgery, and he took a black crust that was badly broken in the patient's thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture above the wound, with pincers and clamps with strong tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then, according to the patient's desires, remove the bandages, rest, and apply poultices for some days, and order that we loosen the ligature; and thus, too, if it concerns the foot or any other part, we must act carefully to avoid harm.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you, who have been called to loosen the ligature, achieve peace and thus ameliorate their pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption is already confirmed in the member, it cannot be restrained, and the corruption does not cease to spread throughout the member until the danger of the illness passes.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And there is another physician who perforates a cancerous abscess, and it becomes inflamed for some days, until the evil of it grows stronger under his control.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes the pain to be pure from melancholic humors, so it does not cover that it will reach him entirely, but rather affects the member where he suffers most intensely.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this, my sons, it is necessary that the operation be divided into two parts: one is an operation associated with health, and another is a work that poses danger to the most important dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this throughout all parts of this book where various operations are discussed, which involve error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against this and set aside those things so that the foolish people do not take them as grounds for speaking against you and slandering you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your tools with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method for the grace of God, leading to salvation and glorious success, set aside the terrible illnesses that are difficult to cure, and abandon those things that make you afraid, so that your courage in your faith and in your name does not desert you: for there is more remaining for your glory, both now and forever after, in the world and behind your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	They already dissected in some of their own signs:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad ailments poorly, so that bad doctors do not become renowned.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter organized within the feet, concerning the forms of instruments and the tools of cautery, and anything necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	Division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter concerns incision and puncture, and the use of suckers, plasters, and the extraction of arrows and similar objects, all chapters organized according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and realignment, and on the treatment of twists and similar conditions; a chapter organized on internal foot structures and the shapes of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and sharp medicine, and recall of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the youth of that cautery and the documents of it, and in what circumstances cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, it is said that the discourse on the quality of cautery youth and the documents of it is a long and prolix speech, subtle for knowledge, and secrets hidden; and much has been spoken about it by wise men, and there are disagreements among them, and I will content myself with a small part of their speeches, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cautery will apply to every universal connection, which is of matter or by matter, except for two connections, which are connections with their own matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the connection that is dry and lacks matter, opinions differ; some say that cautery is beneficial for such conditions, while others claim the opposite, stating that cautery is not suitable for ailments characterized by dryness and scarcity, as the nature of fire is qualities and dryness, and it would be inappropriate to treat a condition that is dry and lacking in moisture with heat and dryness.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who claim the opposite state that cautery is beneficial for all dry and scurvy ailments in the bodies of men, as when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the connection of fire, you find the body of man hard.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And they say through the words of that one, that they have already experimented with this several times to discover.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not advisable for this to be performed by someone who has never been trained and practiced in the art of cauterization, as he/she must know the diversity of human body structures and the disposition of ailments within them, their causes, and the circumstances surrounding their occurrence, and the passage of time.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other cases, there is no cause for fear, especially in dry and humid ailments, as all doctors agree on these, and they are consistent in the use of cauterization to treat them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my sons, that the secret of healing by fire and the goodness of this method, which is called cauterization, lie in the fact that fire is simple; its action affects only the member that is being cauterized, without harming other members or causing great pain.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the medicinal fire reaches those members where it is applied and strongly drives away the pain from difficult-to-heal parts of the body.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Kindle the fire, for its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not cause harm, but rather serves. It has long been known through experience and the long service of studying the art over the truth of causes; therefore, you are excused from the length of this speech. If it were not that I keep secret in this brief moment the fire's power and quality of its operation on bodies and its expulsion of ailments, demonstrated by philosophical discourse, which would sharpen your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know this, my sons, that the times when it is most suitable to perform cauterization and make bandages are in the springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is suitable at all times, so that the damage caused by time is overshadowed by the healing power of cauterization, especially when cauterization is for pain or necessary pains, severe and sharp, which do not suffer from delay, for it is feared those that come with ill will, who are better off asking for small harm to enter at a later time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And therefore do not sit on your feet, my children, for it is only the common people and foolish doctors who consider this illness, which is healed by cautery, never truly cured, leaving behind that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus as they believe, for cautery is but a place of medicine that alters the composition and dries up the humidity, which are the causes why pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet physicians may use cautery excessively for the sake of their skill, virtue, and the greatness of their lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness may return at some time in the future, according to the condition of the illness and the location of the pain, and the virtue of the treatment, and what has been prepared within them from the addition of excesses and humors, and what has come to them through food and similar causes; for the illness on which cautery is performed is a subtle illness in a few members with excessive humors and moisture, so with teeth cautery for pain and similar, it is possible that that pain may not return, but this is done in small doses.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is often said in popular speech that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and although it seems the most effective, I do not believe it to be a cure that benefits from medicine or any other cause, except through cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	But the truth is otherwise; and I understand that the statement "cautery is the last remedy of medicine" only holds when the methods of treatment in certain illnesses are ineffective, and those medicines do not help, so at the end of the cause, one administers cauterization and takes advantage of it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	From here it follows that cautery is considered the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding of popular opinion and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that the gold cautery is better than the iron cautery, and they did not say this except for the equality of the metal and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not burn unless it is absolutely necessary, which is not always true, because one already knows and has experienced that cautery with fire works only in certain bodies for others; but nevertheless when you make cautery with gold fire, it is not declared to be yours, because the gold is consumed according to the amount you want for its brightness, and because it prepares to receive friction; and if you place it over the fire, the gold melts into the fire, and sometimes certain sheets fall into the fire so that the craftsman can catch them due to his occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cautery with iron must be performed more lightly and precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And you have already organized this chapter on cautery according to other chapters, and you have ordered those within the feet first, so that I will now ask him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cautery for head pain caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers humidity and coldness upon the afflicted part, which are two causes of sudden and multiple rheumatic flux, called rigor, from the head to the extremities of the limbs and of the auricles, numerous sleeping disorders, and pains in teeth and throat, and generally all ill health resulting from cold, as well as paralysis, apoplexy, and similar conditions in those maladies.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery is that first, you command the patient to evacuate the malady using lacrimal medicines for three or four nights, depending on the nature of the malady, the age of the patient, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command them to shave their head, and arrange that tool between your fingers on a clean bench, and place your hands on their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place your palm's edge near the sole between his toes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the affected area of the middle part of the body has been identified, press it with your hand to test, and then apply the olive-shaped cautery, which is like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place it over the healthy area without pressing, in a way that descends, so that your hand is constrained little by little, and you lift it up.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then slowly lift your hand and examine the area, and if you see that any bones are exposed, along with an amount of blood, raise your hand again, and if it doesn't return to that position, or another part of the cautery, as it is cooled, it is seen that the bone about which I spoke above.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt, dissolve it over the area, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand over the affected area near the edge, leaving the inner part to be destroyed by the fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the remedy for the pain using a four-ingredient mixture until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague opens up, the better the bran (or perhaps 'arm') gets, making it more robust and rejuvenated.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They also say that the bone should be cauterized within the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's specific nature is hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is attached to the bone, and then cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They also say that with the cautery, the back should be protected until the bone completely hardens, and this is the method of achieving small bones:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that from that place vapours of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound is kept open for a long time, it should be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not recommend these two types of cautery to everyone, but only in certain cases out of fear; leave that to me, for what is best for health when it is present, as we have witnessed with the other members, and especially when the head of the malady is of a heated nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the specific type of cautery that is first mentioned is indeed more safe and better for me; from that comes health and success to the work.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic pain occurs throughout the head and this prolongs the illness, and treatment is with drugs, poultices, cauterization, and other remedies, and especially if a cautery has already been applied that does not alleviate or benefit from any of those causes, then consider whether the nature of the disease is strong; and if there is no great inflammation or severe pain, then apply another cautery to it a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the side of their head with an iron cautery, as long as the skull is cracked.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the skull and expose the amount we have found, then cauterize that with an iron cautery on the rear part of the head at a place called the 'vat',— which is the area where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	Then place your hand over it and do not expose the bone, because this disease causes great pain unlike any other cautery on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you should apply this cautery in its proper place, for this cautery with which the horns of the head and the occipital are cauterized is a subtler cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is its form.

De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	**On the treatment of old migraines.** 
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a severe headache occurs at the base of the skull or pain is felt in the eye, the head should be treated with medicines that clear it, and other treatment as mentioned for various ailments; if it does not improve, cauterization is performed in two ways: either with acute medicinal fire, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Cauterization with burning medicines involves taking a hot iron, cutting off the affected part, and ablating the ends of it from both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut the area of pain in the temple with a lancet, making a small incision until the cord is exposed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then apply pressure over it tightly by constriction, and leave it for three hours; then remove the bandage, lay open the wound, and leave it uncovered for two or three days, and then apply a cold compress until the pain subsides.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that ointment within which it shall heal.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, make use of some of the medicines that I have written about in the two treatises on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The cauterization may be performed in this manner: take a fire of the cautery whose form is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a keyhole because its head is shaped like a claw with no curvature, and at its middle location there is a slight prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then apply pressure to the site of pain, holding your hand—to prevent the wound from becoming infected—and slowly turning the iron at a controlled speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of blood that is congealed due to the specific nature of the wound is such that it equals or exceeds the capacity of the vessel, raise your hand so that the artery below is not congealed, preventing the flow of pus.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then immerse the affected area in salt water, place a compress over it, and leave it for three days; then apply a lot of hot compression, and treat with ointment until it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the edge of the knife with fire according to the cautery, and be careful not to make an arterial incision in this migraine specifically ancient.
Capitol quart.	Capital quarter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of ancient migraine cauterization.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When treating ancient migraine as we have described in the previous treatment and divisions of illnesses, and if the treatment does not work and the illness persists, you should perform a cutaneous cauterization with a knife until it is albified (whitened), indicating that the pain has been alleviated along the line of length from which the greatest part of the said migraine originates or that point; then place your hand over the area once and press strongly to pierce through the arteria and reach within the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to prevent the continuation of the mandible, which is damaged and impairs chewing, that the tear is not aggravated and the nerves, which cause pain in it, are not affected, and that no spasms occur.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is regarding the care and caution of the flow of blood from an artery that is ruptured, as in the case of a rupture, there is fear, especially for those who do not understand what they are doing and lack study and patience; and let the operation on him begin at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And bring to mind the treatment of the flow of blood from an artery accident according to their method in their place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this malady does not respond to the cautery and the patient's condition is tolerable, cauterize in the middle part of the head as we have mentioned earlier, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, apply the cautery as we have said in the chapter on the narrowing of archery with a cautery that has two points, this is the better and more effective cauterization.
