E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel any of the aforementioned signs nor detect any cause for discharge or swelling, as we have said, then know that it is non-penetrating, and you should proceed with caution in treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the flesh of the penis, then the meaning of it is emission of urine from that place and prohibition from urinating until that location is medically consolidated.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	If it is penetrating into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and causes pain in the area, then its sign is that the attempt penetrates here if there is no stiffness within the bone, and it causes pain in the surrounding area; and it will feel hot always; and it does not respond to any treatment, nor is it consolidated with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those penetrating ulcers, there is no complete cure, and the cure for those requires work and diligence from skilled physicians over which they are firmly established.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in those that are neither penetrating nor ancient, healing with iron is hoped for as per what I have advised you, and what you have already tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And indeed, the disease moves between your legs over its sides, raising the patient's legs inside, tilting things towards their belly, and then inserting a lead or iron probe, or if it is in a curved fistula, you must know the location where the probe enters.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if that feels like the disease is around the heart, then you must insert your pointed instrument diagonally into the chest.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel the probe already penetrates and discovers a space, or feels something between the ribcage and that flesh, then you will certainly know that it is penetrating; and thus do not work on that, because there is no healing in that, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	Some doctors, however, say that it heals certain people's legs.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And for the treatment by which one hopes for recovery in them, make subtle cauterizations according to the extent of the fistula, as previously described, and insert that hot iron into the fistula until it reaches around the core; then repeat this process two or three times until you know that all the tissues surrounding the fistula, which are similar to a quill of down, have healed.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	Then attend to those wounds wrapped in bandages until all the tissues that are adjacent are healed, and treat those wounds with medicinal herbs that nourish and consolidate the flesh; if it heals well, it is; otherwise, it will not heal at all with any other treatment.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	If the attempt enters, but does not penetrate into the deep tissue, and between that and the attempt, there is only slightly flesh or a thin membrane, and the fistula affects the surface of the cord, then dry the cord from the beginning of the fistula, and as you dry the attempt, wait until the drying reaches the point where the tip of the attempt enters; and through the attempt, it is freed and cut off.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then clean those infected flesh openings that resemble punctures from a pen, without any rupture due to any cause.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	If a feverish flow of blood comes between you and your operation when you inspect those flesh openings, then the best thing to do is use a sharp instrument, either cauterized with fire or acute medicine, for cautery with fire adjusts the two habits well: it molds those attached flesh, and cuts out the pus by drying up the moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then take care of those wrapped in calluses or hard skin growths that have formed on the edges where there is friction, and also tend to the infection through hardened, burnt-off flesh that generates and solidifies.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And thus, the medicines that involve cleansing and cutting; when you have restored it, it is already healed and you need not fear recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	If a fistula has already perforated into the anus and is elongated from the surface of the body, then insert the finger into the anus and investigate thoroughly.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And so if you sense a tumor and between you and it is clearly of a phlegmatic or fleshly nature, and it is prone to penetration, then it is not surgery upon it but rather through a path of trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The treatment for this condition involves one of three methods: first, cauterizing it as we have mentioned; second, drying it out until you can reach the cavity beneath so that you may insert some remedy; and do not use amputation because you would not be able to close the wound properly, nor let the pus escape, and you should heed the wishes of the patient; and take care of it as we have said, for it will heal strongly. Or else, elongate that membrane and drain the pus that has dried up within it, right next to the anus, as we have mentioned, using a probe or another instrument of sharp extremity, and then clean those fistulated meats with cauterization if necessary; and endeavor to make the complete restoration of all the wounds through surgery, and if the orifice filled with pus does not heal, puncture the open fistula in the anus, and let the pus flow out more gently due to the patient's condition.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And in some cases, the fistula is closed in this manner: when you insert the probe into the fistula, it is on the side of the buttock near the surface of the body and at the margin of the buttock, take the probe of the perforating end, which is thus prepared with a needle in this form.
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert into that wound enveloped in your fields or around those; then, insert the probe into the fistula until you reach its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	If it is penetrant at the margin of the anus very close by, then extract the thread from that trap as you insert the thread into the anus; remove the end of the thread and join both ends together, and leave it thus for a day or two, and when you more deeply cut the thread into the flesh, begin again with that until the flesh between the two ends of the thread is cut through and they fit.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate in some way that you are prepared, either by moving the patient or otherwise, since it is not for you to do this so as not to cause an injury; and then treat it until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spine that through which the fistula is divided: its curvature is sharp in one direction and the other part is not sharp, so as not to cause damage when you do this, thus carefully.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	On the stitching of hemorrhoids where pus flows from the incision of those (hemorrhoids).
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids occur in two ways, either they are between the anus and resemble stones, or those (hemorrhoids) are with the grease of excess weight.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And they are small and large, the wound flows from them at that time and it is one, very red, very hot, and in the extremities of it.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	However, those that are very open at the anus can be treated with a few drops of seawater or a little bit of salt and vinegar, which flow continuously, and they are according to the colour of the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment for those that are inside the anus is that you command the patient to defecate, and press until the pain subsides and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you hold yourself and suspend with your fingers or what you have at hand, and then cut those parts gently to remove the hemorrhoids.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	If the cuts are not held in those by their moisture and softening of them, then take a coarse cloth or a cotton ball or a woolen pad, and remove those from your fingers, and then cut them and sprinkle some powder over them after the incision, so that they adhere to those in place instead of cauterization; or cauterize them as mentioned previously in the chapter on cauterizing.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then attend to those and other remedies until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	If the bowel does not obey and is slow to pass, then sharpen the sickness with a small incision, wash it with water that sits on the stomach, and thus encourage its expulsion when the sickness squeezes.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, their cause is lighter, and it is because you take those with your finger, or take those with wax, and cut them off, then care for those as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And for those who perform the incision, note how to apply stitches to them according to this method: take a thin thread and wrap it around, then insert the needle into the parts above the hemorrhoids, and do the same below, and wrap both ends of the thread on either side of the needle, and tie it taut; and stretch the hemorrhoid with firm compression, and tighten the thread and remove the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do this continuously, leaving none of them untouched, so that the superfluous blood flows from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place your hand over the cloth soaked in warm oil or wax; press it upon the wound and instruct the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then remove that from the wound; and when it is healed, treat those with ointments or other remedies until they are cured.
De curacio de fistulas.	**Curation of Fistulas**
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Fistulas may occur due to drying out (exsecation) of an opening or due to narrowing (costriction) of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And when they are old and no longer respond to that medicine, you will need to clean those with the points of a spatula or with your finger, making sure they remain moist and free from any pus coming from them, which prevents their healing; and then take care of those until they are healed.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Now hold those with a strong reason, more violent than the first that enters, and be careful to cure those that are wounded; then attend to those that need healing.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The treatment of hernia is crucial.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You should know that hernia is crucial, and it does not disappear unless treated according to the color of the body, appearing like a small claw, and it is felt throughout the body, especially in the joints of the feet and legs, and through these pains, you should address it.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then, you should incise what is in the area around the claw, and hold it with forceps or a hook, and eradicate it from its root; and then take care of that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize it as mentioned previously in your chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	May a verruca be a small, rough, round ulceration on the surface of the body, often appearing in the majority of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the treatment for it is to extend and incise that, or open it again with a sharp tool within the wound.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it with fire or sharp medical tools, as we have said.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And now, the warts have been removed both inward and outward with the instrument you have mentioned.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	May a wasp be a small, hardened or rounded ulceration on the surface of the body, often accompanied by itching, and when the doctor feels it, it resembles a wasp sting, and it is found around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the treatment for it is to take a sharp cannula, either of goose or rabbit feathers, and insert it firmly into the swollen lymph node until it retains the shape of the cannula; then rotate your hand with the cannula until you puncture what lies within the circumference of the lymph node, and place it on the base of the flesh, and remove the lymph from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you prefer, make this as a cannula of iron or steel in this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The part protruding from the cannula should be delicate, soft (not perforating), wrapped around itself so that when it is removed from the lymph node, the pain associated with it is alleviated and the rotation of that part is smooth.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish to cauterize the lymph node as mentioned above in the section on cauterization, follow these steps.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the form of instruments that are administered to give ice.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes ice is made from silver or lead or melted earth; and sometimes it is made from those small and large instruments according to those that are administered, for the one that is administered in the treatment of small children is small; and of those whose backs are stiff or painful, the ice of those will be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large and few ice pieces:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The top of the tube of it from above, where the bag is tied, should be wide according to this manner; and its distinction is where the bag is bound as well.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the lower end of it, which is inserted into the anus, should be blunt (not pointed), slightly bent, and tailored to subtlety; and on one side of its length are two channels, and on the other side one channel, and the width of the channel should be according to the thickness of the rays and more narrow a little.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And let the bag be filled with medicinal fluids from a beast's bladder or sheepskin, and its size be that of a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be pierced with many such instruments as it is turned; and if the space between the parts is large, the size of that instrument should be accordingly.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	Then insert into those parts strong, fresh vinegar, or surround them with it; adjust the bag to those parts; and when the bag is in place on the affected area, tighten it firmly between two distinct points at a strong cost, and then bind each part: The quality of binding should be such that you fill the bag with medicine, heated according to the patient's tolerance, and be careful not to make it too tight or too loose.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	Then the patient should be made to lie on their back, raising their legs with pillows so that they rest on something flat or a lance; and apply the tip of the cautery to oil or egg albumen or a paste of fenugreek or similar; then insert it into the anus easily, and let the assistant take over the bag and press and squeeze it vigorously until everything in the rectum is evacuated; then remove the cautery and have the patient raise their legs against the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to vomit, take as much as you can; and if he sleeps with it for the entire night, it is more beneficial for healing.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	If you believe that the patient needs to be treated with hot applications and vomiting to expel the humors, then you should continue with the cautery until healing is achieved.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus there are hemorrhoids or painful ulcers, then use a gentle and warm application, of which the heat should be carefully controlled, as these hot applications are what children are taught to use.
De curacio de las plaguas.	**Curation of Plagues**
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already stated in the previous section regarding the treatment of plagues what is suitable for each case, and you have given the cure for those with more severe conditions and using various medicines according to their needs.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it is said that plagues are diverse according to where they are inflicted and according to the place where the plague strikes.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which plagues occur are thus: the heat of fire, or an incision of space or metal, or a strike with a lance, or a blow with a staff, or an arrow, or similar to those heat-causing factors.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	The plagues that are in the body's parts may also be a plague that strikes the head, or the collarbone, or the foot, or the belly, or the back, and similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And it is very important to recommend the treatment of certain plagues, in order to stop that reasoning and regulate regarding other plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And one should begin with the simple plagues of the head, since the recollection of the compounded ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, it is said that when a simple headache occurs and it is not a fracture, you should consider: if it is due to the pressure of stone or something similar, and the patient has already bitten the tongue and it is a severe pain, and you fear that the disease will progress to apoplexy cauterization, you should immediately puncture and drain the head, and do not delay; and extract the blood from the vein according to the amount of virtue in it, unless there is any other cause prohibiting fleubotomy, especially if the vein that has been left from the plague is small.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And fleubotomy is contrary to the previous procedure; and attention should be given to the patient's diet, as well as avoiding heavy food and drink.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	If, however, any cause prohibits minimization, then the diet should be restricted, and one should avoid meat and wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And regarding the plague, if it develops into cauterization apoplexy, apply a small amount of hot oil or wine in which a stick has been soaked.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	If you are certain of the abscess's location, apply pressure to the sore, if it is fresh and its pus hasn't changed, then carefully extract it.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed it, apply some clean bandages until it heals.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the sore is large or for some reason needs more space and its edges are not properly joined together, then adjust them with stitches according to the suturing method described for them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	If the sore has already exposed the bone and tendon, and it is not a retention but a small suspension, then incise it and treat the wound with medicines and restore the flesh appropriately in the area of the wound, and order the patient to abstain from foods that are rough: seeds and forms similar to their shape, until it heals.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the bone that does not adhere to the bone, you incise all of it that is rotten and remove it, and then take care of it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	If these plagues are an artery or vein from which pus flows and is not severed by medicines, then you should investigate the artery, and if you find one that is not incised, you should incise it with a knife, or tie it off; and if, in the process, it becomes necessary to do something that we have not mentioned, then you should cauterize it until the pus has been drained.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, their cause is considered trivial; so much so that you sprinkle on them this powder, which, when solidified, prevents the air from changing those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil from crushed seeds of dragon's blood, two parts of dried pus, and three parts of finely ground and sieved charcoal; fill the plague with it, and tightly compress it with a good constrictive bandage so that it adheres to the affected area, and coagulate the pus with it.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten it from above with poultices and leave it, and do not loosen it while it is in this condition, for the medicine will not be effective until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And at other times, it requires only cautery, when there is no fever or dragon's blood present.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this surgical procedure is also performed on large hernias when it is necessary to pause and tighten them, and they are recently inflamed with their own blood, the air in them has not been altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has been altered, especially during the summer, then one cannot understand the position of this powder, but instead, apply what we have said, so that you pause over these inflamed places with a paste of eggs or knead flour with water and honey until they are healed; and then apply the other treatment to them.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	If a fracture of the bone occurs in a small area, then you extract it by manipulation.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And tell the cure for skull fractures where it is dangerous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the ailments of the chest.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	If the plague occurs in the chest, it does not differ much in treatment; similarly, the plague of the head is simple when compared to others.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	If the nerves or arteries of the chest are cut, then, if it is a nerve, there is no need for elaborate treatment other than to avoid treatment that causes violent spasms; just as when they inject and bind it with something like vitriol or similar substances to numb them and relax the contraction.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not apply any treatment to the pain without understanding its cause, for the substance of the nerves is affected and their continuity is connected to the brain, which is the source of all the body's members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	If this requires treatment with lighter medicines, it is also washed with water twice, sometimes with rosewater or other water, and then dried with a cloth, keeping the area moist.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the pain is severe, then a suture is administered, or the edges of the wound are bound, and care is taken with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or there is pus in it, then it is pierced at the most painful point.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if the wound already involves an incised artery and there is blood flow, then it should be separated or dried, or tied off, or cauterized if this is necessary to stop the bleeding.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If you have already incised the spine from the nape or entirely, and saved the veins of the neck, then adjust the edges of the wound with sutures over the spine's canal and do not touch it; equalize that and return it to its natural form, and tighten it with appropriate stretch, and leave it for some days; and then care for it with ointment where there is stiffness and excitation until it heals.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the infection has already taken hold within the bone, then probe it, and if there are fragments of foreign bodies, extract all that you can from them; leave what does not belong to the body until the infection dies down, becomes separated, and is removed from the affected area.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the infection is recent, then sprinkle over it the powder that has been recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	If the infection has caused a fistula, then treat it with the water whose memory will come to you in its chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	From the plague of the collar or similar, when it appears between the shoulders and is made with space or a knife or a lance or similarly.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a lance or knife wound and one can feel the depth of it, then consider more carefully if the plague has taken hold and its condition deepens; then you will know that the plague is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if there is no depth in it and the plague is recent, then at first you should apply a poultice to it, and don't press too hard so that the pus isn't trapped in the depth of the wound and returns to affect the heart and cause more harm; instead, apply a comforting ointment to it twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if you don't have any ointment, then place a clean cloth over the wound to absorb whatever comes out; and make the patient lie on the affected area so that whatever is in it can drain properly.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If the plague has passed three days or more and no spasms, tremors of the heart, or tightness of the chest occur, and other good dispositions of the body manifest, then you will know that the plague is safe; and from there, treat those who are sick with calmus and other remedies until they are healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the healing of the plague is prolonged and still open, you will know that a fistula has formed; treat it therefore according to its nature.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is due to an incision of the skin or a wound, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or back, then treat it with the method mentioned above, either with stitching if it's large, or with powder if it's small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If the plague has already affected the bones and you have made an incision to remove parts of it, then you should squeeze the plague and extract the separated pieces.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, leave them inside so that the plague does not spread, as their removal is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidental injuries in the other members, the treatment in youth is the same as what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal ailments.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The condition that occurs in the belly is either great, or slight, or medium-sized.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	For a great amount, one sees the intestine or abdominal nerve, so that their intrusion is made and their suture is either very strong or very delicate.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is made difficult by another method, and I observe that their reduction is more difficult if one does not carefully place them back in their place immediately, as they open up and become thickened so that the insertion into them becomes difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best dislocation is by means of a midline, for in this case the reduction of the hernia is not difficult, whereas it is difficult in both the two types mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And you should know that the suturing of the abdomen is done in four ways, but two sutures are common and suitable for sutures in other parts of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And the other two sutures are specific to other parts, but nevertheless, they are more appropriate for the suture of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to each of you an exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, it is said that when the hernia is small and there is no cause in the abdomen for this, and it is difficult to reduce it, then this is in one of two ways: either because of the minimal disruption as we have mentioned, or when the hernia has swelled due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore, when this occurs, it is necessary to clean that which you immerse in a sponge or cloth dampened in hot water, or take water from a spring, and use it to wash the hernia until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And in some cases, it is useful to use vinegar, which helps in the resolution of inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore, once you have determined that the inflammation is resolved, you should moisten the hernia with water containing high amounts of salt and mullein, for it helps to remove the remaining causes of pain.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the pain persists despite this treatment, then you should incise the disruption using a small instrument to cut away the hemorrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is best when it involves no cutting, and there should be no concern about drying or starvation.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, consider its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	In one part of the sharp knife, and in another part not sharp, and the tip is slightly blunt, rather than having the subtlety of a spatula, it should be somewhat obtuse.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the hernia is enlarged and it pushes out the intestine, you must reduce it to its natural form in its proper place, if possible over that, as it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	When the disruption is wide, and it occurs in the lower part of the belly, you must have the patient lie on their back, and raise their legs higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you must raise the patient's head and foot higher than the affected parts.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And seemingly if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, you must pause your intent and your consideration towards it so that the part where the hernia is located is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is that you must administer this in both great pains and lesser pains.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in smaller pains, prepare what you have, and then make the minister between your fingers, holding it entirely with your hand and adjusting its lips, and then gradually uncover from one place to another, seeking any cause for the rupture, both internal and external.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of stitching: take the needle, or count one needle according to the amount of the width of the wound; then lay it from the extremity of the rupture on the ring finger, and tighten the needle once; be careful not to pass through both extremities of the thread at once, but rather penetrate one strand from each side, within that space where you make the thread enter; and thus you have added the two extremities of the thread and the two extremities of the finger, making four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then tighten the thread double around the needle, sometimes from both sides together, and add both lips and the wound for a proper addition; and leave the thickness of the thread and fix another needle to it, just as if it were the first needle; and do not stop doing this with the needles until you have fully closed the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be of varying thicknesses, between coarse and fine, for the fine needles pierce the flesh lightly; while the thick ones are difficult to insert into the skin, so it is necessary that they be both fine and coarse.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is necessary that the needle be placed in both ends of the hernia gently, so that the flesh is not pierced too deeply and the hernia opens before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And the stitches should not be too long so that the hernia is not obstructed from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then carefully cut the ends of the needles so that they do not injure the patient during their sleep; place them over the wound with expanded poultices from all sides, which have the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the infection is healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these types of suture have needles in what manner is most suitable for small wounds, where one needle or two or even more can be used in the suture.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	However, the second suture is more complex: it consists of administering a suture to all four ends (two from the thigh and two from the calf) at once, using an needle carefully wrapped with thread in a specific thickness and delicacy.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when the needle has penetrated these four ends, return the needle to its initial position from which it began, so that the thread retracts and draws the wound closed in stages; thus, the suture is like a cross-stitch where the threads are tightly strung.

Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	There are two kinds of stitching mentioned according to the account of words.

De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	On the treatment of ulcers and fistulas.

E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and the pain persists as before, then you know that you have not completely eradicated the corruption; so uncover it again carefully and precisely perform its reason and purification with the last strength of your will, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And therefore if it is healthy, so it is; but if not, you will know that this corruption is in the deep, distant part of the body, which has not been reached, and thus to you it is not worth attempting anything there.
