Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	You should know that the fracture of the rib on the right side often leads to prolonged pain, and this may result in frequent incidents of constriction.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	If such incidents occur with the fracture, it is not only a crack or break in its parts, and this becomes a great pain or these pains, and all of this has been under observation.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio. Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	On the restoration of the fractured leg.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the leg there are two bones, of which one is thick and is called the femur; and the other is thin and is called the tibia.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una. E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if two bones are broken at once, the leg is completely shattered.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the bone breaks subtly, the leg is shattered in different ways.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the bone breaks very thickly, it opens up inside, and is one of those causes that are not easily healed.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	Then apply extension, compression, and compression of the joints according to that agreement.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	But if the leg fracture is clean without movements, extension should be less and more gentle, and it will be beneficial to your virtue.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the leg is also a cause for operation on the arm, and when you tie the stitches and complete all the surgical procedure, you will take wooden splints from which the causes are suspended in single pieces, and they are made entirely of palm leaves; align them with those that require slight pressure, do not be harsh on the hands, and let the length of those be according to the length of the leg, and from the inside towards the outside.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And then wrap each drape around the limb in two layers according to its length, placing one at the joint of the leg from one side and the other at the opposite side, ensuring they cover the entire affected area of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	Then secure the two splints at three points on each extremity and in the middle, as this structure prevents the limb from bending at the joint, maintaining a stable position.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And now a splint of wood is applied according to the length of the limb, securing it in place to prevent any further movement.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And it is primarily important that you do this in case of a fracture, especially when the pain is acute.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then, each day, examine the limb and study its condition thoroughly, observing for any signs of inflammation or other similar issues. If any such causes arise, promptly treat it with the appropriate remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Capital XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	On the fracture of the talus and the bones of the foot and toes.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The talus does not suffer a fracture entirely; rather, it is the bones of the foot that sometimes suffer a fracture; and the toes of the foot rarely suffer a fracture, but they do experience wear and tear due to their position and use.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant. E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	Then place your foot over what is elevated due to those bones, and apply pressure, and compress, and bind those until they return to their proper place.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And then apply a plaster and stop it, leaving the abdominal cavity of the foot on a small table with two legs.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	Then tighten that on the foot with a descending stretch, since you have wrapped it with drapes and other causes of which you are in need.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And as the condition passes three or four days, then you will loosen the ligament, since you will find the bones entangled, or broken or dislocated, and the operation on those is just as knowledgeable.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if someone says it is broken, then restore those, entangle them as they were and re-align them in your hands during the restoration of the said bones.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	Then place this broken bone straight according to its length and a little on the side; and then put the foot on this table which is already re-aligned, and tighten that with a descending stretch.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	If what is broken off from the bones is two or three pieces or more, then you should place your hand over each part wrapped in a lion-colored cloth, tighten the table at the bottom of the foot, and stand on one of the table's heads to make an incision into the sole of the foot so that it has a good hold.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is also important that you do not forget to consider all the causes mentioned in other fractures from accidents we have discussed; and be wary of any new accident that may occur.
Capitol .xviii.	**Chapter XVIII**
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	**On Fractures of the Hip Bone, Shin Bone, and Male Genital Bones**
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the hip bone is fractured, apply compression with a bandage, incline the patient slightly to one side, and hold them in that position behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And then the midwife fills the cavity with hot compresses, applying them to the cavity of the patient as is hoped; and the woman is made to tilt her body slightly, lifting the legs one by one, until everything is removed from within, so that it faces the opening of the cavity as is hoped and the broken bone heals.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	Then place powders on the patient's back, and when they want to urinate, help them do so easily, collect the urine, reduce it, and return it according to the manner in which you mixed it at the beginning, then return to their original position.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do so for seven days or around those times, for that is when it is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take a bladder of a sheep and place a tube of canvas over the patient's wound; then insert the entire bladder into the cavity, and blow air into the tube until the bladder is inflated within the cavity, for the fracture heals.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then it is filled with a bandage and left for some days, as we have recommended, until it heals.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the thigh of a man or woman is cracked, then administer in its restoration and healing the same as we have recommended for the hip bone.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And what is right should not be overlooked in these close fractures and rarely does it fail, especially to those who have some knowledge and practice this my book; for that fracture indicates to you in the best dispositions for your restoration and tightness of the bone. And therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the case of a man's leg when it is cracked, take a hot compress from above and place it on the limb; then wrap it with cloth, and have it wrapped up, and leave it for three days or so until it heals.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter .XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of broken bones when they are fractured.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for one who suffers a fracture, especially if the bone is large, as is the bone of the thigh or of an appendage, or similar to those that you cauterize and cut immediately if the conditions for flebotomy on yourself or by testimony allow it, as we have said above.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the infection spreads to the sanium (fever), then know that you must cauterize it by binding it with cloth moistened in the third degree of heat, if another cause is not present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	Then begin to restore the fracture on the patient within a day or two, and do not prolong it, if otherwise there is no risk of gangrene.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	If you experience an apothema (abscess) cautiously, then leave its restoration within the sixth day, until the apothema subsides, and do not touch it on the seventh, eighth, and ninth days of the month, for you might cause other complications.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	If a bone breaks off prominently at an exposed joint, then cover and protect yourself from perforation as you strive to reduce and immobilize it with your hands in a way that facilitates easy and minimal extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	If the extension is beyond your control and the position of the bone is against your hands, then reduce it using whatever tools you have at hand; a tool made of metal, with a length of approximately seven or eight digits (inches), and a width determined by the amount of damage, is ideal for this purpose. For this reason, a doctor must be prepared to use such tools in various amounts during treatment, depending on the type of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be made in such a way that it has a little roughness so that it is not easily bent during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And it should have an acute tip at its end, with its margin in its extremities; and the top of it should be slightly curved, extending from within to the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the shape of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is called "volentary hernia" in Greek, thus it is a rare case.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that the acute end of it is elevated above the prominent end of the bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And it should be done at once before the bone returns to its place, and no operation should be performed.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And so try to intertwine the ends of the fracture among them, and if the end of the broken bone is delicate, and you do not seize the instrument with good precision, then you must insert the end of that bone within the instrument's reach.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	If you are unable to reduce the bone to its proper place using what we have recommended, then cut into it with a scalpel according to what seems necessary to you. Or saw that part of it in any way you can.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	Then scrape that which is attached to the bone, with rough parts and small splinters.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced and the patient feels intense pain, you know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and so do this to bring great relief to the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration of the bone is complete, and you submerge it in a black stippling vinegar, especially in summer, do not place any cloth or other material on the wound, lest it cause decay and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And subsequently, during the final stages of bone restoration, uncover the wound and carefully cut away any remaining debris using scissors or similar tools, and apply bandages according to the extent of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be extremely careful not to reinjure the wound at the site of the fracture, as unskillful doctors often cause complications, leading to death or severe corruption and putrefaction, which is unsanitary.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the fracture's tightness is slight, flexible, different from the tightness of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the plague is severe or a bad one, and you are afraid of further complications that we have encountered, and you feel pain in the area, do not press down on it, but rather wrap it tightly with a cloth of hard linen.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when, after one or two days, the plague begins to generate pus in it, then remove from it the cloth that you had placed over the affected area, and apply some treatment, with which we usually treat plagues, such as a poultice or something similar to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is necessary that you remove the lint and consider the plague each day and evening until it is consolidated and stopped, and ensure that the affected member is prepared in such a way that the pus can flow from it to the surrounding areas with ease.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the plague passes many days and is not consolidated or separated from the arm, then you should know that here are only temporary remedies to prevent the plague from spreading.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those strategies, the ones that are separated and removed, and the ones that are not separated and involve placing members and causing pain, perforate you to incise those according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if you encounter a wound or ulcer that is swollen or some other type of corruption and putrefaction, then you must stop each one of them with whatever you deem suitable for the cure of which a description precedes this in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And regarding what I should say and you present your case: when the flesh is split open, it protrudes over the member as if it were the bone of the thigh and the joints, resembling those of the larger members, and do not attempt to remove it or extract it, as you may cause death; after leaving it alone for a time that it can heal on its own, perhaps 2 or 3 days, then attend to the wound if you see it, and if not, leave it.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter .xx.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the treatment of hernias that occur during the healing of a fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Various complications occur with this hernia during the healing process of a fracture, especially near the joints, and it distorts the shape of the member; thus, it hinders the normal function of the limb.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider if the hernia is recent and administer those medicines that have been found effective for it, such as aloes, senna, and similar herbs; take some or all of these, and apply those with a stypic quality, or alum, or vinegar, and press them onto the hernia in a stoppered manner, and constrict them firmly.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And apply a firm pressure that does not release it for several days; then loosen that and apply another, as long as the hernia persists; or lay a sheet of lead on it, since lead has the property of reducing anything inflated in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If it is already decided that the stone has become hardened and narrowed due to necessity, then divide it by the most superior part of it, and incise the superfluous and protruding part, or quickly remove it before it hardens again; and treat that until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	**Chapter XXI**
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of a fracture: When it is restored, then wrap the delicate and frail member with a cloth according to its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture is restored, and the delicate member is wrapped, it should not be done for trivial reasons: of which one is the abundance of solution of the ligament and of the binding made not according to rule; or because of excessive tightness of the ligaments that prevents nutrition from reaching the member; or because of too much superfluous obstruction; or due to improper movement at an inappropriate time; or because of pus in the body of the patient, and for the debility of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the treatment for this is to restrict the patient's diet and make their heart tender while the pain multiplies; administer a bath; insert gauze and apply pleasure to it.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	Then apply pressure to the member, so that the pressure draws the warm nutrient to it, continuing the application of cold water until the nutrient flows and returns to its natural form.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Regarding the healing of broken bones when they are restored crookedly and surgery is forbidden from them, covering that which should be exposed.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an incident occurs with a member already restored, then focus on healing it from tortuosity and distortion of the broken bone, aiming for the form of the member; however, do not prohibit the natural operation of the member, as long as you receive the permission of the one who considers that member newly broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	Many times, one finds foolish doctors and healers who have practiced this on our land; and this operation is much despised, causing great fear at the sign of which it is fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If the recent loss of mobility and weakness is due to waterlogged joints containing soft herbs, or if they are rubbed with leaves of oak and willow, and similar plants, and then a soothing plaster is applied; or if thick mucilage from willow bark is mixed with hen's eggs or olive oil, and spread as a plaster on top of that; or if fat figs are pressed between the feathers of a goose, imitating those used in certain medical treatments known as consolidants.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	Sometimes, it is dissolved by continuous light friction applied to the most humid areas, and the affected member's movements are encouraged at regular intervals throughout the day.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the deformity has already progressed and is severely twisted, turning into a stone, and its necessity for treatment arises from rust in the metal, then it should be observed that pus has formed on top of it and the continuity of the bone has dissolved, and what is superfluous from the pressure of this joint on the metal is cut away with delicate bone scissors, and relief is provided to that part which has been overstretched and strained.
Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De sermo en dislocacio.	**On Dislocation**
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of one of the body's joints, rendering it immobile and causing the shape of the affected member to be distorted, leading to severe pain and significant injury.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, it should be treated as soon as possible to ensure the joint is reduced and restored. If treatment is delayed, the area becomes inflamed, making it difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And to prevent any additional strain or extension during the amputation process, as movements seen cause spasm and joint pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	If this occurs, you will notice that you need to perform a flap operation on the patient's injury, and then place it in a position that relaxes the amputation; and the affected member should be soaked in warm water and oil, and then reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all members should be treated with the liquid, from which the memory will return to its proper place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And you have already arranged the joints of dislocation as mentioned in the fracture; starting from the upper part of the body, it descends to the lower part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter .XXIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the treatment of a dislocated jaw, let us speak.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	When the two jaws are dislocated due to an injury, it can occur in two ways: either they are slightly displaced from their position with minimal movement, or they are completely dislocated and swollen, preventing the patient from opening their mouth, and the saliva from the wound leaks out, and they cannot hold or close their mouth, and the tongue is wrapped around itself.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	If the dislocation is slight, it may return to its original position on its own with minimal cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	If the dislocation is complete and swollen, it is necessary to immediately administer a reduction of the swelling gently, without delay.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the practitioner should have a firm grasp of the patient's condition, and the doctor should insert his finger into the opening of the dislocation of the jaw inside the patient's mouth if the dislocation is on one side; or he should insert two fingers simultaneously if the dislocation is on both sides, keeping the other fingers outside to which they can be attached; and he should order the patient to close their jaws gently until the jaw returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, especially when both mandibles are permanently dislocated, then apply evaporation with hot water and oil, until a light reduction of both is achieved and do not delay the reduction of both completely, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so when they are returned and tied up, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not relaxed, then place a layer of soft cloth over it, treated with wax and olive oil, and this will facilitate the loosening of the bindings.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And have the patient lie on their back, with their head between two pillows, so that they do not moan to the right or left, and do not force them in any way; having fed them sufficiently, then cut their food into small pieces, until the pain is eased and the jaws are unclenched, then they may eat what they wish.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be facilitated, and do not work on the opening of the mouth during eating, drinking, and excretion, until the jaw is unclenched and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of two jaws is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and not restored to their proper places, then fever and continuous vomiting occur, and the patient's belly is severely distended and he vomits pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, you will know it is a loss; and often the patient dies within a few days of this happening.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the fork (elbow) and the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The fork (elbow) is not displaced from the socket by its continuation in the arm; however, sometimes it is displaced towards the outside part, and this is indicated by sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is that the patient seeks relief on their bed and extends their arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then narrow the opening with your palm tightly closed, so it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then press down on that compress and poultice, and tighten it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	Apply the end of that which dries on the thigh, and continue it to that, so it is not dislocated in any day; then cover that it be reduced and bandaged as we have said and according to your equipment.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then press down on that compress, poultice, and binding, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this treatment, the cure is reduced to the end of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .XXVI.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of a dislocated muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You know that a muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is when it is detached from its origin at the joint.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is when it is dislocated at the insertion of the muscle, and this requires treatment; and it is not dislocated at the rear joints by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated at the front joints by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And it is most commonly dislocated and comes out at the insertion on the outside, especially in those places where there is little flesh, it is easily dislocated; but in those where there is much muscle, it comes out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And often it happens to certain people through a blow or fall, and the muscle of the limb is inflamed from a severe contusion, and it is squeezed by what has already been displaced.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	So now that you understand this regarding the state of being overexerted from him, and you begin to consider his healing process.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of the limb is known when it occurs in such a way that you must remove the covering; so that you distinguish between the displaced muscle and the healthy muscle, since you find among these diversities a manifestation; and you find in the top of the muscle a concavity and place the titillic after touching the top of the muscle just like if one were to press it, and the patient cannot return his hand to its normal position, nor move it without pain.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated in the foot or ankle, and you find evident touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation, gentle reduction is done when it is fresh and the illness is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises the patient's hand to the parts above; then he applies gentle pressure from below, and strengthens the joint in its place, and the minister raises the patient's hand and extends it; and then he places it so that it returns gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	It may be that what we have said does not return, and only from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, a few days later, it is necessary that the illness be bathed in hot water and administered herbs that soften and relax as if they were cut from nettle, fenugreek, and melilot in water, and be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be placed on their back and positioned so that the dislocation hangs in suspension between relaxation and tension; then the doctor places his hand over the area of expectation, raises the head of the muscle towards virtue, pulls the patient's hand away from the parts below, and another minister holds the patient's head so that it is not pulled from the parts below, for then it will return to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce the second in this manner: and do cause to be present a man who is taller than the hernia, and stands on that side, and insert his muscle between the hernia's touch and lift the hernia's touch above its parts until the hernia is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the hernia's hand from the parts beneath his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If the hernia is lighter, then understand that something else causes it to be suspended, so that it becomes serious, because the displacement returns soon.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced precisely in another manner: and this is that a long stick be placed on the ground with a head shaped like mortar, not too thick or too thin, and then the hernia is placed beneath; as it rests upon the head of the stick, the hernia stands according to the length of the stick, and then the hand from above extends towards the parts below the other side; and the body part from the other side is extended with force, because the joint returns to its place at great speed.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if the reduction is difficult due to all the causes mentioned, use this treatment: take a stick, its length should be about two arms' span, and its thickness should be four digits, and shape it like this:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	Then cover the head with a round cloth to prevent the stick from touching the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	Then place yourself between the patient and the stick, extending your hand or arm over it within the space left, and position the stick on the assistant, arm, and end of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Place your arm on a scale at the correct distance, with your hand extended into the space left, and the other side suspended from the opposite end, so that the joint is within the desired range.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the treatment of the patient is completed in any way that is possible for you, and you see that you have placed a light, smooth woolen thread; then prepare a paste with powder from the mill, mixed with egg albumen over all the muscle, so that it is turned away from its original position, tighten the thread gently, place the paste over the thread, the patient's hand should be attached to the collar of the bandage, and left for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it should be ensured that the patient's diet is restricted for a short time, as long as the member is comfortable, as it is lighter on the healing of him.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	Then the diet should be gradually increased over seven or five days, and if there is no pain or discomfort, it means that he is cured.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated due to moisture that occurs in it or other causes, then you should apply a hot cautery with three parts, as mentioned in the chapter on cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and after five days the ligament and joint are not healed, and the bandages and compression are reduced on him several times, and it is not held firm and he cannot raise that arm to its normal position, then know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, are already damaged or stretched or softened, and know that the joint will never stay in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	In case of dislocation, the foot and ankle or the joints behind should be reduced by pressure and extension of the muscles, until it returns to its normal position.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And both the compression and treatment should be applied to that other joint, and care should be taken until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the healing is slow in the member and there is delay in its movements, then the disease uses hot baths several times until that gravity is removed and it returns to its original nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .XXVII.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and seems to return with difficulty; it is dislocated entirely, most notably from the front to the back, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from your sight or touch if some figure is dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip, this becomes clearly evident to you, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm nor touch its muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And take care to reduce the dislocation as soon as it becomes apostemic, because if you see it become apostemic, reduction is difficult and complete healing unlikely; especially when it's in the back parts, as it's worse than all other types of dislocation, causing greater pain, and often results in death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And for the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce, his hand should be extended to two sides, and his arms expanded, and the doctor's hands are on his shoulder and under him, and he presses the joint with the fingers of both hands until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is in the front parts, then return it by bending his hand with his other hand, until it strikes the shoulder with the tip of his palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not yield to reduction, then apply vigorous extension and strong motion.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two assistants extend the arm, and these two assistants hold this view so that there is no relapse in extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then turn the arm over all parts, because it is wrapped with a long folded cloth on his hand, or ligature.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he applies some oil to it to prevent the causes that lead to its stiffness and facilitate lubrication of the joint, then vigorously massage the joint until it returns to normal.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	Then return the intestine to its cavity, which is pressed upon that paste where there is stiffness and application of white of egg, and be sure to remove any tightness and descending, and let the arm hang from the collarbone, and leave it for a few days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Then it becomes loose; and so if the joint is formed in its place, you loosen the ligament of it and leave that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not too tight, then you reapply the paste and ligament, and leave it for a few days until it becomes loose; then you loosen it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	If it occurs due to gravity during the reduction of the joint and its disposition is in movement, then administer humidification in a bath and subtle friction, and compression, as long as it is relieved; or apply heat over the affected joint, if it's a case of oily motion; and wrap it up, leaving that over the bone during the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then you wrap it up and immerse it in a bath; when it is dry, rub the joint with warm friction, repeating over the affected area until the pain subsides, once, twice, and three times.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	in the bath, until it is relaxed.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, apply a hot, wet compress over the split in the cow's hide and wrap it tightly; do this several times, as it is moistening and returning to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder, which is the joint between the arm and hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	In some cases, the shoulder can be dislocated, and its reduction is delicate, unlike other joints, but it is essential to act quickly in reducing it as soon as it is displaced, so that the location does not become stiff or that a fracture occurs in it.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocation is that you place the shoulder joint of the patient on a table and make them extend their arm, and the doctor places his hand or palm on the vicinity of the joint, and gently pushes it back to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it is important to consider that if the palm has already been placed on the patient's stomach, the patient should then place their back on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation was first noticed in the back of the hand, then the position of the arm should be inherently on the table so that the doctor's hand can work on the vicinity of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And so return as soon as possible; if not, tighten the compress gently, release the hernia, and leave it be; for if you do not act promptly, the pain will increase and you will not be able to reduce the hernia any further over time.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	Although the joint may be frozen due to its stiffness, the disease does not have a clear cause; rather, the hand becomes softened and cannot grasp any object. You should know that the nerves are cut or torn, and there is no pain in it unless it is strained with a hot cautery near its attachment, which gives it some relief.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, when the condition improves, you should focus on the compress we have applied, leave it in place and tighten it for several days; then loosen it, leave it alone, and exercise your hand over it.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	If the movement of it is stopped and some pain occurs, you can relieve it by applying a cold water compress and friction a few times, until it is eased.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocated joints.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes, the joints become completely dislocated.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a joint is dislocated, either in the back of the hand or on the palm, hold the joint tightly and gently push to reposition it, until it returns to its place.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then support the head of the joint, suspend the affected part, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then suspend it and extend it until it is right again on that very day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night falls, according to that second account, do not stop loosening it during the day and exercising movement, and do so at night; and do this for several days until it is tight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And if it is displaced in the mother's womb, attach that to that opening and do the first operation on it until it heals.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly, do this when it is displaced in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocated spinal vertebrae.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a complete dislocation occurs in any of the spinal vertebrae or those of the neck, it is often accompanied by severe pain, as the vertebrae are out of their proper position, and at such times, there is no cure, for death can result from the malady.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that the removal of the disease is against their will, and they cannot contain it; often, certain members of them or both legs or both arms or one of these become mollified, or a spine from its place is removed, often times, and often times the removal of these to four parts is done.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, when it is removed in these behind parts, it is called gout.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	The cure for it is that you consider whether the gout occurs from childhood, because in those cases there is neither a cure nor a complete healing of it.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	In cases where you see it from accident or impact or something similar to these, the Ancients have already spoken of remedies in lengthy discourse, of which the most beneficial returns; but you have perhaps already been frustrated by that which offers little excuse due to its excessive use, for my close proximity to understanding has exposed and shaped me from various tools of that kind, by which I will demonstrate and space out this very issue.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And it is said that the inflammation which occurs at the base of the foot, is neither cause nor cure for that part; and it resembles that which is done in two places.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And for those, only the one that occurs on the back itself is cured with this method.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And since the illness has spread over its face, close to the wall, and has extended beneath them great pain so that the chest of the patient cannot be moved.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	Then take a straight stick, pause it upright, placing one end on the ground at the foot's extreme near the patient's head, and another stick, with its feet, at the other extreme of the foot.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister shall hold the stick, not fixed in a pit; and another minister shall hold the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then cover the patient's head and leave the thin linen bandage to hold them firm; extend the end of the bandage to the foot which is opposite their head, and tie it there; and tighten the other bandage over their hips, towards the back of their legs, and make it fast to their leg-bandages; and adjust all the bandages and tie those to the other foot.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the minister should extend the bandage towards the joint of the foot, and the two feet and the bandages on their places where they are fixed should not be loosened, but nevertheless they are not tightly bound as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his palms on the spine with strength while he waits for it to return, or he may place them on a table, and then adjust the patient's feet on the table until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	If it does not return in this manner, take a table whose width or length is three arms' lengths, and dig into the wall where we have said that the patient's condition is most severe.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the weight of the table on the spine, and the doctor places his feet on the other extremity, pressing firmly until the spine is compressed and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open it by turning your hand; and since you are standing on the ground, hold the patient's head with two fists, the length of which should be a arm, and place their head firmly in the back of the punch, exactly with two fists; and this is the length that is between each fist and the thumb, and when you make a cut on each fist, it must be deep enough, and each finger should be held firmly on the ground so as not to cause any harm.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And make another round fist where the turn is, and twist it in both directions of the two fists.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a punch where the fist is formed, the length of which is a palm where it is turned; and in the other two fists, they are similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the ligaments you have straightened on the patient's foot in the wound from which the head of the bone is to be removed, and the ligaments you have tightened on his thighs in the turn where his legs are to be healed.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then each turn should have a minister who twists the turn with his hand, and the doctor equally ties the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And after the spine is returned to its place and the area is tied, cover it with a dry, clean cloth, then stop; then place over the plaster a table from which the width is three or four times the length of the affected area, and the length of it should encompass the spot of inflammation, and on the side of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the remedy we have mentioned, using subtle nutrition of the patient until it is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any signs of recurrence appear at the site after healing, it is necessary to administer remedies that soften and clean the area with a long-term table treatment, which we have recommended; this is already being administered in the form of lead plaster there.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And in some cases, imminence occurs at the end of the spine, caused by dislocation; it is that bone which you should be most careful not to expose to this medicine, as it will severely cause death to you.
Capitol .xxxi.	**Chapter XXXI.**
De curacio de anca dislocada.	**On the Cure for a Dislocated Hip.**
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You should know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle should only suffer dislocation, and not what happens to other joints with small removal and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the ankle is dislocated in four manners, for it can be dislocated inwardly, outwardly, forwardly, or backwardly.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is most commonly dislocated inwardly, and rarely forwardly or backwardly.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The sign of the dislocation in the inward parts is that, when you straighten the patient's leg against the illness, it becomes longer, and the inside is more prominent than the outside, and the patient cannot bend their foot towards the shin bone; this is where the tongue of the muscle becomes detached from its attachment, so that the head of the muscle is already affected here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that which causes dislocation is when parts are separated outside, as the accidents of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of that which causes dislocation in the front parts is when the leg expands fully but does not bend in the knee; if it perforates and cannot be brought back to the front parts, then the patient's urine is retained and their testicles are swollen, and you should move the patient to a bed.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of that which causes dislocation in the back parts is that it does not expand the thigh, nor can it bend the knee opposite to where it doubles up; the leg becomes shorter than the other, and the testicle becomes softened, and the head of the limb points to that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of the symptoms of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already been reduced by itself or through your treatment according to its disposition, then it is not suitable for further cure; and thus there should be no further projection in its treatment.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	Place it on that part where the dislocation is recent and it is one of the four types of dislocations, then cut when you return the joint and stretch it inwards and outwards, and turn it to the right and left, for the bones will quickly return and need no other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If it does not return in this manner, then prepare a strong support and extend the patient's leg from the affected side, or use a ligature, or a tight bandage placed over their thigh; another minister should extend your hand from above so that he places his fingers behind the patient's testicles; and nearby, tighten the ligature at the root of the issue, and have another minister hold the end of the ligature.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And extend it either from the leg or from within to open up the angle at the base of the spine, or from behind to the front of the back.
